intro: Onosma dalmatica var. densiflora, commonly known as the Dalmatian onosma, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. This variety is noted for its compact growth habit and ornamental value in gardens.
